ygData.subject: Bards - still the forgotten class....
ygData.msgSnippet: From EverLore, copied from the message boards - see if you can spot what s missing. I am a relatively new player to this game. I started around Christmas of
ygData.messageBody:
From EverLore, copied from the message boards - see if you can spot what's
missing.

"I am a relatively new player to this game. I started
around Christmas of 1999. But despite
many complaints
from many different people about
imbalances and
gameplay issues, i still think it's a
great game. I love
the fact that a worrior can kick, duel
weld, wear nice
armour, and have tons of HP. I love a
cleric's ability to
heal its members, to stun monsters, and
to cure
various diseases, and remove poisons. I
love a druid's
ability to do a little of everything, i
love Spirit of
Wolves, i love share wolf form, and their
ability to
group teleport. I love a wizard's ability
to Cast cool
looking spells and unleash their wrath
upon hordes of
monsters. I love a mage's ability to
summon items,
pets, and weapons. I love a shadow
knight's harm
touch, their life drain spells, and
others. I love rogues
for their ability to backstab, to evade
and to hide. I
love a shamen's ability to buff and to
summon cool
animal pets. I love an enchanters'
ability to change
appearance, to mez monsters and to
control the life
and death of a group. I love rangers;
Targeting
monsters from afar, using their mighty
marksmenship.
Oh yeah, Necro's are cool too. I love the
interdepence
of various classes in order to succeed in
the game. i
love the interaction between players in
the game. And
most of all, i love everquest. Thank you
Verant, to
putting me in the state of Euphoria that
i am in.

Thank you Azeca, and thanks as well to
everyone
else who takes their personal time and
energy to
write something positive in this sea of
negativity.
It is posts like this that keep us all
going, driven to
maintain EverQuest as the best MMRPG for
years
to come.

-Gordon
"
